comment.author: 47524421@N08
comment._content: Lockheed SP-2H (P2V-7S) Neptune BuNo 150283 - Only P2V-7 introducted as new into US Navy service under the new designation SP-2H. On September 25, 1962 this aircraft was loaned straight from the production line to the CIA for covert work. It was returned to the Navy in 1967. In 1977 it entered the civil registry as N283RR with Neptune Aviation Services in Missoula, MT, and later as N712AU. At some point it was converted to an air tanker, and reregistered again as N442NA on December 12, 2007. As 'Tanker 42' it crashed on April 25, 2009 in the Oquirrh mountains in Utah while enroute, with three fatalities.
